Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gnome-online-accounts
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome-online-accounts bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: GNOME Online Accounts is a single sign-on framework for the GNOME desktop, which provides the user with an easy way to log into their online accounts under the GNOME desktop environment. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, memory errors occurred due to race conditions in threaded code. Consequently, goa-daemon terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault when Kerberos was used for authentication. With this update, the race conditions have been fixed and the Kerberos code has been split into a separate process, so it no longer affects the main daemon. As a result, goa-daemon no longer crashes in this scenario and is now more resilient against these types of bugs. (BZ#1099115) Previously, leaks in file descriptors for the timerfd() system calls occurred. As a consequence, the goa-daemon process ran out of file descriptors and terminated unexpectedly. A patch has been applied to eliminate the leaks, and goa-daemon no longer crashes in this scenario. (BZ#1029316) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: This update introduces a GSettings whitelist for filtering providers. As a result, administrators are now able to selectively disable providers that are available to users. (BZ#1080539) Ticket renewal for smartcard-based Kerberos accounts is now supported. (BZ#864917) Users of gnome-online-accounts are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
